title: When you compliment Riots game Design in Gameplay

replies.body: Im one of those people who needs this explained... Help?

It might be a reference to some old book describing, in one of its chapters, the consequences of oppressing a herd with an omnipotent shepherd. If I remember correctly, the ruler of a kingdom was quite harsh on a particular community and was sent a few plagues in return; the eighth such plague was a swarm of locusts that ravaged crops.

I shall leave the interpretation up to you.
I know the story with the pharoh XD I meant what does the JOKE mean :P

It's a reference to Exodus in the bible, Ramses II opressed the jews in Egypt. God punished them (after a warning of Moses to let the Jewish slaves free) by setting the plagues. (sry for bad English, its my third language)

It's referencing a bibilical plague.  Billions of locusts would descend on farmlands and eat crops there.  It's referencing that if someone compliments riots balance, then they get attacked by a ton of people, like locusts on farms.
Damn, God really gave those guys the middle finger.

I sent the locusts on the wind
Such as the world has never seen
On every leaf on every stalk
Until there's nothing left of green

I SEND MY SCOURGE 
I SEND MY SWORD 
THUS SAITH, THE LOOOORD
